p: To determine the diameter of the halo inhibition of the bacteria growth induced by P. abies, A. alba, P. cembra, and P. mugo essential oils, the bacterial strains were suspended in LB broth to obtain a turbidity of 0.5 McFarland (approximately 10 8 Colony-Forming Unit/mL—CFU/mL) and then plated on LB broth with agar in a Petri plate. Sterile disks (6 mm diameter, Oxoid) were placed on the agar and impregnated with 10 µL of samples. Two µL of gentamicin from a stock solution (10 mg/mL) was used as a positive control After 24 h, the inhibitory activities of each essential oil were recorded as mm of halo diameter without growth [ 58] using a vernier caliper rule. The mean and the respective standard deviation (SD) of the measured halo in three independent experiments were recorded.
